intro: Cleistanthus salicifolius, commonly known as the willow-leaved cleistanthus, is a deciduous tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves that resemble willow leaves, hence its common name. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in catkins, and it is often found in moist, tropical forests. It has a shallow root system and is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils. The tree is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in some regions.
